description.p: You speak words of encouragement empowered by enchantment magic to a creature that can hear you within range. The target gains 1d4 temporary hit points until the end of its next turn, and it can’t have disadvantage on the first attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.
The number of temporary hit points gained increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).

You infuse the ground in a 5-foot cube centered on a point you choose within range with unstable, explosive energy until the start of your next turn. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn, the energy erupts. Each creature within 5 feet of the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 fire damage. The spell then ends.
This spell’s damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

As part of the action used to cast this spell, you must make a melee attack with a weapon against one creature within the spell’s range, otherwise the spell fails. On a hit, the target suffers the attack’s normal effects, and some of its essence is siphoned into you.
You gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. You lose any remaining temporary hit points at the start of your next turn.

The spell’s damage and the temporary hit points you gain increase when you reach higher levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra 1d6 necrotic damage to the target, and you gain an additional 1d6 temporary hit points. Both rolls increase by 1d6 at 11th level and 17th level.

You predict an imminent misfortune for a creature you choose within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, roll a d4 on the Misfortune table to determine what poor luck befalls the target.

tr.td: The first time the target moves 5 feet or more before the spell ends, it trips and falls prone.
An inexplicable object immediately falls onto or flies into the target dealing 1d6 bludgeoning damage.
The target has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the spell ends as sun gets into its eyes, a loud noise distracts it, or some other appropriate event occurs.
The next attack roll a creature makes against the target before the spell ends has advantage as the target’s armor breaks, a weak spot reveals itself, or some other appropriate event occurs.

description.p: You can roll an additional d4 for the Misfortune table when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4). If you roll different misfortunes for the target, they each occur.

You hurl a mass of billowing shadows at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 psychic damage, and if it’s Medium or smaller, the air becomes filled with shadows in a 5-foot cube centered on the target until the start of your next turn. While filled with shadows, Medium and smaller creatures in the area have disadvantage on attack rolls.
This spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

You craft a magical weapon from the ether which takes a form of your choice to attack a nearby foe. Make a melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (your choice). The weapon disappears after the attack.
This spell’s damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).
